intro: Stackhousia maidenii var. flexuosa, commonly known as the slender stackhousia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white or pale pink flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is considered rare in the wild.
